bibl.title: Letter from George E. Armstrong to Philip Showalter Hench, January 29, 1953

div1.p: Armstrong thanks Hench for his report on the Camp Lazear dedication. He appreciated Beaulac designating Mason and Lampner to place the wreaths in his name.

div1.head: Letter from George E. Armstrong to Philip Showalter Hench, January 29, 1953
div1.opener:
DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE
DEPARTMENT OF THE ARMY
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
WASHINGTON 25, D. C.
29 January 1953
IN REPLY REFER TO
MEDCE-MI
Ask of proper to make
Set for W R Mrs Am
(& Reed?)
Philip S. Hench, M.D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Your letter of 15 January 1953 is most interesting and I have
enjoyed reading your memorandum concerning the ceremonies at the
dedication of Camp Lazear in Havana. Both General Streit and I
were disappointed that the weather prevented his attendance at the
dedication. It was indeed kind of Ambassador Beaulac to designate
Colonel Mason and Major Lampner to act for me in the absence of
General Streit and place the wreaths in my name. I have written
to Ambassador Beaulac expressing my appreciation and asking him
to convey my thanks to the Officers concerned.

When you receive the complete set of films from Dr. Nogueira,
showing the unveilings and placement of the wreaths, would it be
possible for you to loan them to me for a short time so that we
can have copies made for our Medical Museum? Any pieces of the
original wood from Building No. 1, left over after the restoration,
which you wish to distribute to the Armed Forces Medical Museum
will be greatly appreciated and copies of the photographs taken
at the dedication ceremonies will be of considerable historical
value in years to come in connection with these pieces of original
wood and the other materials (reports, descriptions, drawings, etc.,
concerning the work of Walter Reed and his associates) already in
the possession of the Museum.

closer.signed:
GEORGE E. ARMSTRONG
Major General
The Surgeon General
